gurmukhi: nYhr kutMb qij ibAwhy ssurwr jwie gunnu kY kulwbDU ibrd khwveI
transliteration: Naihar Koutanb Taji Biaahay Sasuraar Jaai , Gounanu Kai Kulaabadhoo Birad Kahaavaee ?
translation: Just as a girl leaves her parent's house after getting married and earns a respectable name for herself and her husband's family by virtue of her good traits;

gurmukhi: purn piqbRiq Aau gur jn syvw Bwie giH mY giHysuir sujsu pRgtwveI
transliteration: Puran Patibrati Au Gur Jan Sayvaa Bhaai , Grih Mai Grihaysuri Sujasu Pragataavaee ?
translation: Earns the honourable title of all in all and revered one, by devotedly serving her elders and remaining loyal and faithful to her partner;

gurmukhi: AMq kwil jwie piRA sMig sihgwmnI huie lok prlok ibKY aUc pd pwveI
transliteration: Ant Kaali Jaai Pria Sangi Sahigaamanee Hui , Lok Paralok Bikhai Ooch Pad Paavaee ?
translation: Departs from this world as an honourable companion of her husband and earns name for herself here and in world hereafter;

gurmukhi: gurmuK mwrg BY Bwie inrbwhu krY DMn gurisK Awid AMq ThrwveI ]119]
transliteration: Gurmoukh Maarag Bhai Bhaai Nirabaahu Karai , Dhann Gursikh Aadi Ant Tthaharaavaee ?119?
translation: So is a Sikh of Guru worthy of praise and adulations from beginning to end who treads the path of the Guru, lives life in the reverential fear of the Lord. (119)
